L By: lijogk March 4, 2009 20 Ways to Increase Blog Visibility Content Marketing This YouMoz entry was submitted by one of our community members. The author’s views are entirely their own (excluding an unlikely case of hypnosis) and may not reflect the views of Moz. I am new to SEOmoz and love learning new things in Internet marketing. Let me share some tips to increase your blog visibility. If there are any mistakes or suggestions, please comment. Use social bookmarking sites such as Digg, Sphinn, Mixx and del.icio.us to bookmark your sites and blog content. Create an online community in Google, Yahoo, Orkut, etc. and try to get as many members as possible and also try to be active in the communities. Sign in to Google feedburner, burn your blog feeds, and then add an e-mail subscription link on your blog. Write an e-book or get it written by some experts and make it available to your site readers. Add your logo and services in that e-book. Write an article related to your site and submit it to article sites. Allow guest bloggers to blog on your blog. Join online communities related to your field and try to help fellow community members and add a signature link to your blog. Test your blog and make it compatible to all browsers. Use Google Analytics to track your visitors to get an idea about what they actually want from your blog. Then try to give them what they want. Make quality newsletters for your subscribers and send out useful newsletters on a weekly basis. Do-follow commenting helps to get traffic and back links. Don’t misuse it; make sure you take your time and write a quality comment. Make a YouTube channel .Use your handicam to create small video sessions in your niche. Brand your videos; add your site’s advertisement at the start of the video. Sponsor online or offline events relating to your niche. Write a neat press release and publish at online PR sites such as PRweb.com. Use alt tags for images. (See Matt Cutts explaining about importance of image alt tags) Ask your friends to give you honest feedback on your site. The best way to find someone to do any kind of work on your site is through personal recommendation. Create a Squidoo lens. Add a poll widget on your blog, People always love to participate. It will get repeated visitors and traffic. Help people in Yahoo Answers. It will give you lots of traffic. Happy blogging ( do check my blog too)! Copied! Back to Top
